results.title: Glee
results.creator_credit: Bradley Buecker, Brad Falchuk Teley-vision, Ryan Murphy Productions and 20th Century Fox Television
results.brief_description: In this musical comedy, optimistic high school teacher Will Schuester tries to refuel his own passion while reinventing the high school’s glee club and challenging a group of outcasts to realize their star potential as they strive to outshine their singing competition while navigating the cruel halls of McKinley High.

constellations_other.name: Viral music videos
constellations_other.description: Gotye's 'Somebody that I used to know' was one of the internet's most viral music videos, seconded only to Queen Bey's 'Singles Ladies'.

results.title: Glazing
results.creator_credit: Richard Philps and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: The film deals entirely with glazing, demonstrating the techniques of glazing mugs, jugs, dishes and bowls, and the decorative effects that can be obtained. The use of transparent glaze is explained and in addition, extra glazing effects such as matt stoneware glaze and oxides on rough and smooth surfaces are demonstrated.

results.title: Glaucoma: Sneak thief of sight
results.brief_description: Discusses the causes, diagnosis, and control of glaucoma, stressing the urgency of early detection of the disease in order to prevent blindness. Depicts various forms of the disease and includes artwork sequences to explain the anatomy of the eye.

results.title: Glassmakers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
A survey of the wide range of glass products manufactured by British craftsmen. Includes manufacture of plate glass and installation of a large sheet in one of the Festival of Britain buildings; making of stained glass windows; manufacture of optical glass and lenses; prisms and lanterns for lighthouses; production of electric light globes; glass blowing and making of nahd0made cut glass.

results.title: Glasshouse soils
results.creator_credit: Mary Beales, Jack Chambers and Central Office of Inofrmation Film
results.brief_description: Shows the need for regular sterilisation of glasshouse soils if plant diseases are to be avoided. The methods used at the Cheshunt Experimental and Research Station, England, are described.

results.title: Glasses for Susan a new day
results.brief_description: In an effort to emphasize the importance of good vision in many areas of daily life, this film follows the course of a young schoolgirl as she blunders her way along, ignorant that she has poor eyesight. With the help of an alert teacher she becomes aware of her problem and in the process of acquiring a pair of new glasses she gains a new visual perspective of the world.

results.title: Glasses
results.creator_credit: Brian Duchscherer, Marcy Page and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Young Milo is a sensitive boy who like most other children just wants to be accepted at school. Above all, he yearns for the freedom and independence enjoyed by his comic book hero, Captain Cosmo, and resents his mother’s constant care and attention especially the plain, generic lunchbox she gives him instead of a Captain Cosmo one that all his other classmates own. What really holds Milo back is his poor eyesight: the world is fuzzy and this makes things difficult. He is rejected by the soccer team because he cannot score properly and ridiculed in class because he constantly misreads the numbers on the cards which his teacher puts before him. However, a trip to the optometrist and a pair of glasses improves things. But not totally. Though Milo can now read the numbers correctly in class, he still encounters trouble at soccer and bullying from his classmates. When things are at rock bottom however, Milo learns what is important and has his first experience of accepting life for what it is. Brian Duchscherer’s puppet animation is a joy to watch and brings to vivid life recognisable characters and important themes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Duchscherer, Marcy Page and National Film Board of Canada

What really holds Milo back is his poor eyesight: the world is fuzzy and this makes things difficult. When things are at rock bottom however, Milo learns what is important and has his first experience of accepting life for what it is. results.title: Glass slide magic lantern
results.brief_description:
Glass slide projector as used by Department of Agriculture, Melbourne.
Lens can be compacted or extended, see attached images from ICS.
Modifications include addition of electricity and edision bulb.
1 Box containing 2 parts.

results.title: Glass menagerie
results.creator_credit: Paul Newman, Burtt Harris and Columbia
results.brief_description: A shy girl seeks escape from reality of life in the St. Louis of the Great Depression and from her mother’s fantasies of constantly reliving the glory of her youth. The fragile balance of the family is changed when her brother arranges for a “gentleman caller” to pay a visit. Based on the play by Tennesse Williams. Stars Joanne Woodward, John Malkovich and Karen Allen.
